q: Don't ever save anything for a special occasion. Being alive is the special occasion.
h:
“Don't ever save anything for a special occasion. Being alive is the special occasion.” —
Mary Engelbreit

q: Thinking is difficult, that's why most people judge.
h:
“Thinking is difficult, that's why most people judge.” —
Carl Jung

q: A man with outward courage dares to die: a man with inner courage dares to live.
h:
“A man with outward courage dares to die: a man with inner courage dares to live.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Repetition does not transform a lie into a truth.
h:
“Repetition does not transform a lie into a truth.” —
Franklin D. Roosevelt

q: Your next step is simple. You are the first domino.
h:
“Your next step is simple. You are the first domino.” —
Gary Keller

q: He who laughs at himself never runs out of things to laugh at.
h:
“He who laughs at himself never runs out of things to laugh at.” —
Epictetus

q: There is no path to Happiness. Happiness is the path.
h:
“There is no path to Happiness. Happiness is the path.” —
Dan Millman

q: The moment you stop to think about whether you love someone, you've already stopped loving that person forever.
h:
“The moment you stop to think about whether you love someone, you've already stopped loving that person forever.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: Hardly anybody recognizes the most significant moments of their life at the time they happen.
h:
“Hardly anybody recognizes the most significant moments of their life at the time they happen.” —
W.P. Kinsella

q: If the plan doesn't work, change the plan, but never the goal.
h:
“If the plan doesn't work, change the plan, but never the goal.” —
Unknown

q: The educated differ from the uneducated as much as the living differ from the dead.
h:
“The educated differ from the uneducated as much as the living differ from the dead.” —
Aristotle

q: Without the rain there would be no rainbow.
h:
“Without the rain there would be no rainbow.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: I'm an optimist by choice not by stupidity.
h:
“I'm an optimist by choice not by stupidity.” —
Yanni

q: The size of your success is measured by the strength of your desire; the size of your dream; and how you handle disappointment along the way.
h:
“The size of your success is measured by the strength of your desire; the size of your dream; and how you handle disappointment along the way.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: Winners are not afraid of losing. But losers are. Failure is part of the process of success. People who avoid failure also avoid success.
h:
“Winners are not afraid of losing. But losers are. Failure is part of the process of success. People who avoid failure also avoid success.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: When you're curious, you find lots of interesting things to do.
h:
“When you're curious, you find lots of interesting things to do.” —
Walt Disney

q: Life is filled with secrets. You can't learn them all at once.
h:
“Life is filled with secrets. You can't learn them all at once.” —
Dan Brown

q: We can see through others only when we can see through ourselves.
h:
“We can see through others only when we can see through ourselves.” —
Bruce Lee

q: No idea, no matter how good, will work if it doesn't get used.
h:
“No idea, no matter how good, will work if it doesn't get used.” —
Peter A. Cohen

q: The energy of the mind is the essence of life.
h:
“The energy of the mind is the essence of life.” —
Aristotle

q: Most people spend more time and energy going around problems than in trying to solve them.
h:
“Most people spend more time and energy going around problems than in trying to solve them. ” —
Henry Ford

q: One loyal friend is worth ten thousand relatives.
h:
“One loyal friend is worth ten thousand relatives.” —
Euripides

q: No duty is more urgent than that of returning thanks.
h:
“No duty is more urgent than that of returning thanks.” —
James Allen

q: To become what you are not, behave as you do not.
h:
“To become what you are not, behave as you do not.” —
T.S. Eliot

q: Although the world is full of suffering, it is also full of the overcoming of it.
h:
“Although the world is full of suffering, it is also full of the overcoming of it.” —
Helen Keller

q: The privilege of a lifetime is to become who you truly are.
h:
“The privilege of a lifetime is to become who you truly are.” —
Carl Jung

q: The trouble with the rat race is that even if you win, you're still a rat.
h:
“The trouble with the rat race is that even if you win, you're still a rat.” —
Lily Tomlin

q: Live calmly. The time will come when the flowers bloom by themselves.
h:
“Live calmly. The time will come when the flowers bloom by themselves.” —
Zen Proverb

q: The only man who never makes mistakes is the man who never does anything.
h:
“The only man who never makes mistakes is the man who never does anything.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: When you judge another, you do not define them, you define yourself
h:
“When you judge another, you do not define them, you define yourself” —
Wayne Dyer

q: The greatest gift that you can give to others is the gift of unconditional love and acceptance.
h:
“The greatest gift that you can give to others is the gift of unconditional love and acceptance. ” —
Brian Tracy

q: Don't change your mind just because people are offended; change your mind if you're wrong.
h:
“Don't change your mind just because people are offended; change your mind if you're wrong.” —
Criss Jami

q: I would rather be hated for who I am than loved for who I'm not.
h:
“I would rather be hated for who I am than loved for who I'm not. ” —
Wayne Dyer

q: What the mind can conceive, it can achieve.
h:
“What the mind can conceive, it can achieve.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: If you want to change how you see your problems, you have to change what you value and/or how you measure failure/success.
h:
“If you want to change how you see your problems, you have to change what you value and/or how you measure failure/success.” —
Mark Manson

q: The most effective way to do it, is to do it.
h:
“The most effective way to do it, is to do it.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: We may not be able to stop evil in the world, but how we treat one another is entirely up to us.
h:
“We may not be able to stop evil in the world, but how we treat one another is entirely up to us.” —
Barack Obama

q: Mastery is not a function of genius or talent, it is a function of time and intense focus applied to a particular field of knowledge.
h:
“Mastery is not a function of genius or talent, it is a function of time and intense focus applied to a particular field of knowledge.” —
Robert Greene

q: Don't listen to the person who has the answers; listen to the person who has the questions.
h:
“Don't listen to the person who has the answers; listen to the person who has the questions.” —
Albert Einstein

q: The search for happiness is one of the chief sources of unhappiness.
h:
“The search for happiness is one of the chief sources of unhappiness.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: Projecting your mind into a successful situation is the most powerful means to achieve goals.
h:
“Projecting your mind into a successful situation is the most powerful means to achieve goals. ” —
Estee Lauder

q: There are two primary choices in life: to accept conditions as they exist, or accept the responsibility for changing them.
h:
“There are two primary choices in life: to accept conditions as they exist, or accept the responsibility for changing them.” —
Denis Waitley

q: Unless a man is master of his soul, all other kinds of mastery amount to little.
h:
“Unless a man is master of his soul, all other kinds of mastery amount to little.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: You can do nothing to change the past, and the future will never come exactly as you plan or hope for.
h:
“You can do nothing to change the past, and the future will never come exactly as you plan or hope for.” —
Dan Millman

q: Talk to someone about themselves and they'll listen for hours.
h:
“Talk to someone about themselves and they'll listen for hours.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: Fools resist. The wise embrace.
h:
“Fools resist. The wise embrace.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: It still holds true that man is most uniquely human when he turns obstacles into opportunities.
h:
“It still holds true that man is most uniquely human when he turns obstacles into opportunities.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: He who knows best knows how little he knows.
h:
“He who knows best knows how little he knows.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: The fewer the words, the better the prayer.
h:
“The fewer the words, the better the prayer.” —
Martin Luther

q: The only way round is through.
h:
“The only way round is through.” —
Robert Frost

q: Time stays long enough for anyone who will use it.
h:
“Time stays long enough for anyone who will use it.” —
Leonardo da Vinci

q: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
h:
“The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.” —
Mahatma Gandhi

q: All know the way; few actually walk it.
h:
“All know the way; few actually walk it. ” —
Bodhidharma

q: A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable but more useful than a life spent doing nothing.
h:
“A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable but more useful than a life spent doing nothing.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: Always keep your eyes open. Keep watching. Because whatever you see can inspire you.
h:
“Always keep your eyes open. Keep watching. Because whatever you see can inspire you.” —
Grace Coddington

q: Trust, but verify.
h:
“Trust, but verify.” —
Ronald Reagan

q: Life is like a wheel. Sooner or later, it always comes around to where you started again.
h:
“Life is like a wheel. Sooner or later, it always comes around to where you started again.” —
Stephen King

q: True friendship ought never to conceal what it thinks.
h:
“True friendship ought never to conceal what it thinks. ” —
St. Jerome

q: Confidence is the greatest friend.
h:
“Confidence is the greatest friend.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Don't set your own goals by what other people make important.
h:
“Don't set your own goals by what other people make important.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: Do the hard jobs first. The easy jobs will take care of themselves.
h:
“Do the hard jobs first. The easy jobs will take care of themselves.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: You can often change your circumstances by changing your attitude.
h:
“You can often change your circumstances by changing your attitude.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Confuse them with your silence and amaze them with your actions.
h:
“Confuse them with your silence and amaze them with your actions.” —
Unknown

q: We have to walk in a way that we only print peace and serenity on the Earth. Walk as if you are kissing the Earth with your feet.
h:
“We have to walk in a way that we only print peace and serenity on the Earth. Walk as if you are kissing the Earth with your feet.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: You become stronger with every problem you face and every obstacle you overcome.
h:
“You become stronger with every problem you face and every obstacle you overcome.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Some people dream of success, while others wake up and work hard at it.
h:
“Some people dream of success, while others wake up and work hard at it.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: It matters not who you love, where you love, why you love, when you love or how you love, it matters only that you love.
h:
“It matters not who you love, where you love, why you love, when you love or how you love, it matters only that you love.” —
John Lennon

q: The major difference between the big shot and the little shot is the big shot is just a little shot who kept on shooting.
h:
“The major difference between the big shot and the little shot is the big shot is just a little shot who kept on shooting.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Nothing makes a man broad-minded like adversity.
h:
“Nothing makes a man broad-minded like adversity.” —
Will Rogers

q: A successful man is one who can lay a firm foundation with the bricks others have thrown at him.
h:
“A successful man is one who can lay a firm foundation with the bricks others have thrown at him. ” —
David Brinkley

q: Be strong. Be confident. Be the star of your own life.
h:
“Be strong. Be confident. Be the star of your own life.” —
Estee Lauder

q: Someday death will take us to another star.
h:
“Someday death will take us to another star.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: Little minds have little worries, big minds have no time for worries.
h:
“Little minds have little worries, big minds have no time for worries.” —
Ralph Waldo Emerson

q: I defeat my enemies when I make them my friends.
h:
“I defeat my enemies when I make them my friends.” —
Dalai Lama

q: To find yourself, think for yourself.
h:
“To find yourself, think for yourself.” —
Socrates

q: I know not all that may be coming, but be it what it will, I'll go to it laughing.
h:
“I know not all that may be coming, but be it what it will, I'll go to it laughing.” —
Herman Melville

q: Where violence reigns, reason is weak.
h:
“Where violence reigns, reason is weak.” —
Nicolas Chamfort

q: My sun sets to rise again.
h:
“My sun sets to rise again.” —
Robert Browning

q: Life is just the same as learning to swim. Do not be afraid of making mistakes, for there is no other way of learning how to live!
h:
“Life is just the same as learning to swim. Do not be afraid of making mistakes, for there is no other way of learning how to live!” —
Alfred Adler

q: Always remember that you are absolutely unique. Just like everyone else.
h:
“Always remember that you are absolutely unique. Just like everyone else. ” —
Margaret Mead

q: Animals don't hate, and we're supposed to be better than them.
h:
“Animals don't hate, and we're supposed to be better than them.” —
Elvis Presley

q: Find the game where you can win, and then commit your life to playing it; and play to win.
h:
“Find the game where you can win, and then commit your life to playing it; and play to win.” —

q: Inspire yourself to be great. Being good isn't good enough.
h:
“Inspire yourself to be great. Being good isn't good enough.” —
Gurbaksh Chahal

q: The secret of life isn't what happens to you, but what you do with what happens to you.
h:
“The secret of life isn't what happens to you, but what you do with what happens to you.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: You are today where your thoughts have brought you.
h:
“You are today where your thoughts have brought you.” —
James Allen

q: Nothing important is learned; it is simply remembered.
h:
“Nothing important is learned; it is simply remembered.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: Everybody needs a passion. That's what keeps life interesting.
h:
“Everybody needs a passion. That's what keeps life interesting.” —
Betty White

q: If you don't know where you're going, you will probably end up somewhere else.
h:
“If you don't know where you're going, you will probably end up somewhere else.” —
Laurence J. Peter

q: One of the oldest human needs is having someone to wonder where you are when you don't come home at night.
h:
“One of the oldest human needs is having someone to wonder where you are when you don't come home at night. ” —
Margaret Mead

q: It is not enough to win a war; it is more important to organize the peace.
h:
“It is not enough to win a war; it is more important to organize the peace.” —
Aristotle

q: Success is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get.
h:
“Success is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: One of the keys to happiness is a bad memory.
h:
“One of the keys to happiness is a bad memory.” —
Rita Mae Brown

q: Be truthful about your emotions, and use your mind and emotions in your favor, not against yourself.
h:
“Be truthful about your emotions, and use your mind and emotions in your favor, not against yourself.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: Live in the sunshine, swim the sea, drink the wild air.
h:
“Live in the sunshine, swim the sea, drink the wild air.” —
Ralph Waldo Emerson

q: The glow of one warm thought is to me worth more than money.
h:
“The glow of one warm thought is to me worth more than money.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: Don't try to be young. Just open your mind. Stay interested in stuff.
h:
“Don't try to be young. Just open your mind. Stay interested in stuff.” —
Betty White

q: Understanding that rests in what it does not understand is the finest.
h:
“Understanding that rests in what it does not understand is the finest.” —
Zhuangzi

q: To improve is to change, so to be perfect is to change often.
h:
“To improve is to change, so to be perfect is to change often.” —
Winston Churchill

q: While some of us act without thinking, too many of us think without acting.
h:
“While some of us act without thinking, too many of us think without acting.” —
Dan Millman

q: This is such a short and precious life that it's really important that you don't spend it being unhappy.
h:
“This is such a short and precious life that it's really important that you don't spend it being unhappy.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: The soul should always stand ajar, ready to welcome the ecstatic experience.
h:
“The soul should always stand ajar, ready to welcome the ecstatic experience.” —
Emily Dickinson

q: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
h:
“Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.” —
Dalai Lama

q: It is often safer to be in chains than to be free.
h:
“It is often safer to be in chains than to be free. ” —
Franz Kafka

q: You may be one person in this world, but to one person you may mean the world.
h:
“You may be one person in this world, but to one person you may mean the world.” —
Unknown

q: If your happiness depends on what somebody else does, I guess you do have a problem.
h:
“If your happiness depends on what somebody else does, I guess you do have a problem.” —
Richard Bach

q: I will not walk backward in life.
h:
“I will not walk backward in life.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: Be kind whenever possible. It is always possible.
h:
“Be kind whenever possible. It is always possible.” —
Dalai Lama

q: The most important thing in life is to stop saying 'I wish' and start saying 'I will'. Consider nothing impossible, then treat possibilities as probabilities.
h:
“The most important thing in life is to stop saying 'I wish' and start saying 'I will'. Consider nothing impossible, then treat possibilities as probabilities.” —
Charles Dickens

q: The more something threatens your identity, the more you will avoid it.
h:
“The more something threatens your identity, the more you will avoid it.” —
Mark Manson

q: Do one thing every day that scares you.
h:
“Do one thing every day that scares you.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: When you have to make a choice and don't make it, that is in itself a choice.
h:
“When you have to make a choice and don't make it, that is in itself a choice.” —
William James

q: Thought is so cunning, so clever, that it distorts everything for its own convenience.
h:
“Thought is so cunning, so clever, that it distorts everything for its own convenience.” —
Jiddu Krishnamurti

q: A heart is not judged by how much you love, but by how much you are loved by others.
h:
“A heart is not judged by how much you love, but by how much you are loved by others.” —
Judy Garland

q: Men are disturbed not by things, but by the view which they take of them.
h:
“Men are disturbed not by things, but by the view which they take of them.” —
Epictetus

q: Perhaps the most tragic thing about mankind is that we are all dreaming about some magical garden over the horizon, instead of enjoying the roses that are right outside today.
h:
“Perhaps the most tragic thing about mankind is that we are all dreaming about some magical garden over the horizon, instead of enjoying the roses that are right outside today.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.
h:
“Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.” —
Thomas Edison

q: The road to success is always under construction..
h:
“The road to success is always under construction..” —
Lily Tomlin

q: You can never get enough of what you don't need to make you happy.
h:
“You can never get enough of what you don't need to make you happy.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: Stop being tormented by everyone else's reaction to you.
h:
“Stop being tormented by everyone else's reaction to you.” —
Joyce Meyer

q: Mistakes are painful when they happen, but years later a collection of mistakes is what is called experience.
h:
“Mistakes are painful when they happen, but years later a collection of mistakes is what is called experience.” —
Denis Waitley

q: The primary point of this existence is to live, and all living things move and grow.
h:
“The primary point of this existence is to live, and all living things move and grow.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Living a life that has a greater purpose and living up to it is the ultimate degree that we should strive for.
h:
“Living a life that has a greater purpose and living up to it is the ultimate degree that we should strive for.” —
Gurbaksh Chahal

q: Don't let the behavior of others destroy your inner peace.
h:
“Don't let the behavior of others destroy your inner peace.” —
Dalai Lama

q: If you love somebody, let them go, for if they return, they were always yours. If they don't, they never were.
h:
“If you love somebody, let them go, for if they return, they were always yours. If they don't, they never were.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: Lying can never save us from another lie.
h:
“Lying can never save us from another lie.” —
Vaclav Havel

q: Who you are is always right.
h:
“Who you are is always right.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: We don't stop playing because we grow old; we grow old because we stop playing.
h:
“We don't stop playing because we grow old; we grow old because we stop playing.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: One always begins to forgive a place as soon as it's left behind.
h:
“One always begins to forgive a place as soon as it's left behind.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Doubt is an uncomfortable condition, but certainty is a ridiculous one.
h:
“Doubt is an uncomfortable condition, but certainty is a ridiculous one.” —
Voltaire

q: If you are not living each day with excitement, energy, and passion, then you are not living true to your life purpose.
h:
“If you are not living each day with excitement, energy, and passion, then you are not living true to your life purpose.” —
Celestine Chua

q: If you do not change direction, you may end up where you are heading.
h:
“If you do not change direction, you may end up where you are heading.” —
Lao Tzu

q: It's your outlook on life that counts.
h:
“It's your outlook on life that counts.” —
Betty White

q: Yesterday is but today's memory, tomorrow is today's dream.
h:
“Yesterday is but today's memory, tomorrow is today's dream.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: The less people know, the more stubbornly they know it.
h:
“The less people know, the more stubbornly they know it.” —
Osho

q: Every act of creation is first an act of destruction.
h:
“Every act of creation is first an act of destruction.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: The wisdom of life consists in the elimination of the nonessentials.
h:
“The wisdom of life consists in the elimination of the nonessentials.” —
Lin Yutang

q: Fashion fades, only style remains the same.
h:
“Fashion fades, only style remains the same.” —
Coco Chanel

q: Stop acting so small. You are the universe in ecstatic motion.
h:
“Stop acting so small. You are the universe in ecstatic motion.” —
Rumi

q: If they wrote it to make money, don't read it.
h:
“If they wrote it to make money, don't read it.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: By the practice of meditation, you will find that you are carrying within your heart a portable paradise.
h:
“By the practice of meditation, you will find that you are carrying within your heart a portable paradise.” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: To be calm is the highest achievement of the self.
h:
“To be calm is the highest achievement of the self.” —
Zen Proverb

q: Rest and be kind, you don't have to prove anything.
h:
“Rest and be kind, you don't have to prove anything.” —
Jack Kerouac

q: Only when one allows themself the right to die, do they then give yourself the permission to live.
h:
“Only when one allows themself the right to die, do they then give yourself the permission to live.” —
C. Sean McGee

q: Circumstances rule men; men do not rule circumstances.
h:
“Circumstances rule men; men do not rule circumstances. ” —
Herodotus

q: From the errors of others, a wise man corrects his own.
h:
“From the errors of others, a wise man corrects his own.” —
Publilius Syrus

q: Tis not too late to seek a newer world.
h:
“Tis not too late to seek a newer world.” —
Heraclitus

q: Things do not have meaning. We assign meaning to everything.
h:
“Things do not have meaning. We assign meaning to everything.” —
Tony Robbins

q: We know nothing of tomorrow, our business is to be good and happy today.
h:
“We know nothing of tomorrow, our business is to be good and happy today.” —
Sydney Smith

q: Only the hand that erases can write the true thing.
h:
“Only the hand that erases can write the true thing.” —
Meister Eckhart

q: What we dwell on is who we become.
h:
“What we dwell on is who we become.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: Your friends will know you better in the first minute you meet than your acquaintances will know you in a thousand years.
h:
“Your friends will know you better in the first minute you meet than your acquaintances will know you in a thousand years.” —
Richard Bach

q: Success is about doing the right thing, not about doing everything right.
h:
“Success is about doing the right thing, not about doing everything right.” —
Gary Keller

q: Art is to console those who are broken by life.
h:
“Art is to console those who are broken by life.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: We live only now. Everything else is either passed or is unknown.
h:
“We live only now. Everything else is either passed or is unknown.” —
Marcus Aurelius

q: If you want to feel happy, do something for yourself. If you want to feel fulfilled, do something for someone else.
h:
“If you want to feel happy, do something for yourself. If you want to feel fulfilled, do something for someone else.” —
Simon Sinek

q: What do we live for if not to make life less difficult for each other?
h:
“What do we live for if not to make life less difficult for each other?” —
T.S. Eliot

q: The people who succeed are irrationally passionate about something.
h:
“The people who succeed are irrationally passionate about something.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: Be who you are and say what you feel because those who mind don't matter and those who matter don't mind.
h:
“Be who you are and say what you feel because those who mind don't matter and those who matter don't mind.” —
Dr. Seuss

q: Let each man exercise the art he knows.
h:
“Let each man exercise the art he knows.” —
Aristophanes

q: Work for something because it is good, not just because it stands a chance to succeed.
h:
“Work for something because it is good, not just because it stands a chance to succeed.” —
Vaclav Havel

q: Do not think you will necessarily be aware of your own enlightenment.
h:
“Do not think you will necessarily be aware of your own enlightenment.” —
Dogen

q: Learn to use your emotions to think, not think with your emotions.
h:
“Learn to use your emotions to think, not think with your emotions.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: No man becomes rich unless he enriches others.
h:
“No man becomes rich unless he enriches others.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: It doesn't matter what you do, only how well you do it.
h:
“It doesn't matter what you do, only how well you do it.” —
Dan Millman

q: All our knowledge has its origins in our perceptions.
h:
“All our knowledge has its origins in our perceptions.” —
Leonardo da Vinci

q: Determine never to be idle. No person will have occasion to complain of the want of time who never loses any.
h:
“Determine never to be idle. No person will have occasion to complain of the want of time who never loses any.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: A man that flies from his fear may find that he has only taken a short cut to meet it.
h:
“A man that flies from his fear may find that he has only taken a short cut to meet it.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: Dream big. Start small. But most of all, start.
h:
“Dream big. Start small. But most of all, start.” —
Simon Sinek

q: Nothing external to you has any power over you.
h:
“Nothing external to you has any power over you.” —
Ralph Waldo Emerson

q: People with clear, written goals, accomplish far more in a shorter period of time than people without them could ever imagine.
h:
“People with clear, written goals, accomplish far more in a shorter period of time than people without them could ever imagine.” —
Brian Tracy

q: When you judge others, you do not define them, you define yourself.
h:
“When you judge others, you do not define them, you define yourself.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: The more acquaintances you have, the less you know them.
h:
“The more acquaintances you have, the less you know them.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: As one grows weaker one is less susceptible to suffering. There is less hurt because there is less to hurt.
h:
“As one grows weaker one is less susceptible to suffering. There is less hurt because there is less to hurt.” —
Jack London

q: Always be a first-rate version of yourself, instead of a second-rate version of someone else.
h:
“Always be a first-rate version of yourself, instead of a second-rate version of someone else.” —
Judy Garland

q: Presents are made for the pleasure of who gives them, not the merits of who receives them.
h:
“Presents are made for the pleasure of who gives them, not the merits of who receives them.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: A hopeless man is a very desperate and dangerous man, almost a dead man.
h:
“A hopeless man is a very desperate and dangerous man, almost a dead man.” —
Robert F. Kennedy

q: To live is to be willing to die over and over again.
h:
“To live is to be willing to die over and over again.” —
Pema Chodron

q: If the grass is greener on the other side, maybe that's because you're not taking good care of your grass.
h:
“If the grass is greener on the other side, maybe that's because you're not taking good care of your grass.” —
Unknown

q: The more rejection you get, the better you are, the more you've learned, the closer you are to your outcome.
h:
“The more rejection you get, the better you are, the more you've learned, the closer you are to your outcome.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Without struggle, no progress and no result. Every breaking of habit produces a change in the machine.
h:
“Without struggle, no progress and no result. Every breaking of habit produces a change in the machine.” —
G.I. Gurdjieff

q: Every great change is preceded by chaos.
h:
“Every great change is preceded by chaos.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: A man who acquires the ability to take full possession of his own mind may take possession of anything else to which he is justly entitled.
h:
“A man who acquires the ability to take full possession of his own mind may take possession of anything else to which he is justly entitled.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try Again. Fail again. Fail better.
h:
“Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try Again. Fail again. Fail better. ” —
Samuel Beckett

q: Man must use what he has, not hope for what is not.
h:
“Man must use what he has, not hope for what is not.” —
G.I. Gurdjieff

q: We can't help everyone, but everyone can help someone.
h:
“We can't help everyone, but everyone can help someone.” —
Ronald Reagan

q: FOCUS - Follow One Course Until Successful
h:
“FOCUS - Follow One Course Until Successful” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: Expect the best, plan for the worst, and prepare to be surprised.
h:
“Expect the best, plan for the worst, and prepare to be surprised. ” —
Denis Waitley

q: Wise men speak because they have something to say; Fools because they have to say something.
h:
“Wise men speak because they have something to say; Fools because they have to say something.” —
Plato

q: We can know only that we know nothing. And that is the highest degree of human wisdom.
h:
“We can know only that we know nothing. And that is the highest degree of human wisdom.” —
Leo Tolstoy

q: Work harder on yourself than you do on your job.
h:
“Work harder on yourself than you do on your job.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Intelligence, imagination, and knowledge are essential resources, but only effectiveness converts them into results.
h:
“Intelligence, imagination, and knowledge are essential resources, but only effectiveness converts them into results.” —
Peter Drucker

q: Never close your lips to those whom you have already opened your heart.
h:
“Never close your lips to those whom you have already opened your heart.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Remember the entrance to the sanctuary is inside you.
h:
“Remember the entrance to the sanctuary is inside you.” —
Rumi

q: Change happens when the pain of holding on becomes greater than the fear of letting go.
h:
“Change happens when the pain of holding on becomes greater than the fear of letting go.” —
Spencer Johnson

q: Help others achieve their dreams and you will achieve yours.
h:
“Help others achieve their dreams and you will achieve yours.” —
Les Brown

q: The dreamers are the saviors of the worlds.
h:
“The dreamers are the saviors of the worlds.” —
James Allen

q: Turn your face to the sun, as flowers know how to do.
h:
“Turn your face to the sun, as flowers know how to do.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Greatness comes from living with purpose and passion.
h:
“Greatness comes from living with purpose and passion.” —
Ralph Marston

q: Being wrong brings the opportunity for growth.
h:
“Being wrong brings the opportunity for growth.” —
Mark Manson

q: If fear is too strong, the genius is suppressed.
h:
“If fear is too strong, the genius is suppressed.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: When the mind is calm, how quickly, how smoothly, how beautifully you will perceive everything.
h:
“When the mind is calm, how quickly, how smoothly, how beautifully you will perceive everything.” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: Life is like stepping onto a boat which is about to sail out to sea and sink.
h:
“Life is like stepping onto a boat which is about to sail out to sea and sink.” —
Shunryu Suzuki

q: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
h:
“We suffer more often in imagination than in reality. ” —
Seneca

q: Everything will be ok in the end. If it's not ok, it's not the end.
h:
“Everything will be ok in the end. If it's not ok, it's not the end.” —
John Lennon

q: Intense love does not measure, it just gives.
h:
“Intense love does not measure, it just gives.” —
Mother Teresa

q: Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.
h:
“Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.” —
Mark Twain

q: It doesn't matter if the glass is half empty or half full. Be grateful you have a glass - you're the only person that can decide what's in it.
h:
“It doesn't matter if the glass is half empty or half full. Be grateful you have a glass - you're the only person that can decide what's in it.” —
Gurbaksh Chahal

q: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
h:
“We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.” —
Aristotle

q: He who violates another's honor loses his own.
h:
“He who violates another's honor loses his own.” —
Publilius Syrus

q: A man is not called wise because he talks and talks again; but if he is peaceful, loving and fearless then he is in truth called wise.
h:
“A man is not called wise because he talks and talks again; but if he is peaceful, loving and fearless then he is in truth called wise. ” —
Buddha

q: One day, in retrospect, the years of struggle will strike you as the most beautiful.
h:
“One day, in retrospect, the years of struggle will strike you as the most beautiful.” —
Sigmund Freud

q: Best be yourself, imperial, plain, and true.
h:
“Best be yourself, imperial, plain, and true.” —
Robert Browning

q: Beginning today, treat everyone you meet as if they were going to be dead by midnight. Your life will never be the same again.
h:
“Beginning today, treat everyone you meet as if they were going to be dead by midnight. Your life will never be the same again.” —
Og Mandino

q: Our truest life is when we are in dreams awake.
h:
“Our truest life is when we are in dreams awake.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: Optimism, when applied to your life, develops strength and peace within you.
h:
“Optimism, when applied to your life, develops strength and peace within you.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Rewards and punishment is the lowest form of education.
h:
“Rewards and punishment is the lowest form of education.” —
Zhuangzi

q: The only limits in our life are those we impose on ourselves.
h:
“The only limits in our life are those we impose on ourselves.” —
Bob Proctor

q: Just trust that everything is unfolding the way it is supposed to. Don't resist... Great things are waiting for you around the corner.
h:
“Just trust that everything is unfolding the way it is supposed to. Don't resist... Great things are waiting for you around the corner.” —
Sonia Ricotti

q: Closing your eyes and listening to silence is self-care.
h:
“Closing your eyes and listening to silence is self-care.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: Opportunities don't often come along. So, when they do, you have to grab them.
h:
“Opportunities don't often come along. So, when they do, you have to grab them.” —
Audrey Hepburn

q: Deeds will not be less valiant because they are upraised.
h:
“Deeds will not be less valiant because they are upraised.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: Fear is stupid. So are regrets.
h:
“Fear is stupid. So are regrets.” —
Marilyn Monroe

q: Realistic people do not accomplish extraordinary things.
h:
“Realistic people do not accomplish extraordinary things.” —
John Eliot

q: You need a plan to build a house. To build a life, it is even more important to have a plan or goal.
h:
“You need a plan to build a house. To build a life, it is even more important to have a plan or goal.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Half the world is composed of people who have something to say and can't, and the other half who have nothing to say and keep on saying it.
h:
“Half the world is composed of people who have something to say and can't, and the other half who have nothing to say and keep on saying it.” —
Robert Frost

q: A wise man will be master of his mind, a fool will be its slave.
h:
“A wise man will be master of his mind, a fool will be its slave.” —
Publilius Syrus

q: Let us always meet each other with smile, for the smile is the beginning of love.
h:
“Let us always meet each other with smile, for the smile is the beginning of love.” —
Mother Teresa

q: We tend to live up to our expectations.
h:
“We tend to live up to our expectations.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: Often we pass beside happiness without seeing it, without looking at it, or even if we have seen and looked at it, without recognizing it.
h:
“Often we pass beside happiness without seeing it, without looking at it, or even if we have seen and looked at it, without recognizing it.” —
Alexandre Dumas

q: Don't look for meaning in the words. Listen to the silences.
h:
“Don't look for meaning in the words. Listen to the silences.” —
Samuel Beckett

q: Simplicity is the glory of expression.
h:
“Simplicity is the glory of expression.” —
Walt Whitman

q: I believe that one of life's greatest risks is never daring to risk.
h:
“I believe that one of life's greatest risks is never daring to risk.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: Guilt is perhaps the most painful companion of death.
h:
“Guilt is perhaps the most painful companion of death.” —
Coco Chanel

q: The birth of the mind is the death of the senses.
h:
“The birth of the mind is the death of the senses.” —
Dan Millman

q: Some people find fault like there is a reward for it.
h:
“Some people find fault like there is a reward for it. ” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Where focus goes, energy flows.
h:
“Where focus goes, energy flows.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Shoot for the moon, because even if you miss, you'll land among the stars.
h:
“Shoot for the moon, because even if you miss, you'll land among the stars.” —
Les Brown

q: The danger of an adventure is worth a thousand days of ease and comfort.
h:
“The danger of an adventure is worth a thousand days of ease and comfort.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: If we are honest with ourselves, most of us will have to admit that we live out our lives in an ocean of fear.
h:
“If we are honest with ourselves, most of us will have to admit that we live out our lives in an ocean of fear.” —
Jon Kabat-Zinn

q: The first rule of business; treat others like they want to treat you.
h:
“The first rule of business; treat others like they want to treat you.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Chase your passion, not your pension.
h:
“Chase your passion, not your pension. ” —
Denis Waitley

q: Life is not always a matter of holding good cards, but sometimes, playing a poor hand well.
h:
“Life is not always a matter of holding good cards, but sometimes, playing a poor hand well. ” —
Jack London

q: What most people need to learn in life is how to love people and use things instead of using people and loving things.
h:
“What most people need to learn in life is how to love people and use things instead of using people and loving things.” —
Unknown

q: Most people get ahead during the time that others waste.
h:
“Most people get ahead during the time that others waste.” —
Henry Ford

q: Do not stop thinking of life as an adventure.
h:
“Do not stop thinking of life as an adventure.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: I will love the light for it shows me the way, yet I will endure the darkness because it shows me the stars.
h:
“I will love the light for it shows me the way, yet I will endure the darkness because it shows me the stars.” —
Og Mandino

q: Persistence. Perfection. Patience. Power. Prioritize your passion. It keeps you sane.
h:
“Persistence. Perfection. Patience. Power. Prioritize your passion. It keeps you sane.” —
Criss Jami

q: A change is brought about because ordinary people do extraordinary things.
h:
“A change is brought about because ordinary people do extraordinary things.” —
Barack Obama

q: Courage is fear that has said its prayers and decided to go forward anyway.
h:
“Courage is fear that has said its prayers and decided to go forward anyway.” —
Joyce Meyer

q: He will win who knows when to fight and when not to fight.
h:
“He will win who knows when to fight and when not to fight.” —
Sun Tzu

q: Charms strike the sight, but merit wins the soul.
h:
“Charms strike the sight, but merit wins the soul.” —
Alexander Pope

q: You are what you believe in. You become that which you believe you can become.
h:
“You are what you believe in. You become that which you believe you can become.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: Care about what other people think and you will always be their prisoner.
h:
“Care about what other people think and you will always be their prisoner.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Normal is the average of deviance.
h:
“Normal is the average of deviance.” —
Rita Mae Brown

q: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams! Live the life you've imagined.
h:
“Go confidently in the direction of your dreams! Live the life you've imagined.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: The meaning of life is to find your gift. The purpose of life is to give it away.
h:
“The meaning of life is to find your gift. The purpose of life is to give it away.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: You have within you right now, everything you need to deal with whatever the world can throw at you.
h:
“You have within you right now, everything you need to deal with whatever the world can throw at you.” —
Brian Tracy

q: The more people you help become successful the more successful you become.
h:
“The more people you help become successful the more successful you become.” —
Steve Harvey

q: There are as many opinions as there are experts.
h:
“There are as many opinions as there are experts.” —
Franklin D. Roosevelt

q: No matter who you are, we're creatures of habit. The better your habits are, the better they will be in pressure situations.
h:
“No matter who you are, we're creatures of habit. The better your habits are, the better they will be in pressure situations.” —
Wayne Gretzky

q: Identification with our mind causes thought to become compulsive.
h:
“Identification with our mind causes thought to become compulsive.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: Fools read fast. Geniuses reread.
h:
“Fools read fast. Geniuses reread.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
h:
“It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.” —
Aristotle

q: Outstanding people have one thing in common: an absolute sense of mission.
h:
“Outstanding people have one thing in common: an absolute sense of mission. ” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Success is never final; failure is never fatal.
h:
“Success is never final; failure is never fatal.” —
Conrad Hilton

q: There are few reasons for telling the truth, but for lying the number is infinite.
h:
“There are few reasons for telling the truth, but for lying the number is infinite.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: Because of your smile, you make life more beautiful.
h:
“Because of your smile, you make life more beautiful.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: Life is love and love is life.
h:
“Life is love and love is life.” —
Elvis Presley

q: There are two things a person should never be angry at, what they can help, and what they cannot.
h:
“There are two things a person should never be angry at, what they can help, and what they cannot.” —
Plato

q: It only takes a split second to smile and forget, yet to someone that needed it, it can last a lifetime.
h:
“It only takes a split second to smile and forget, yet to someone that needed it, it can last a lifetime.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: Through selfless service, you will always be fruitful and find the fulfillment of your desires.
h:
“Through selfless service, you will always be fruitful and find the fulfillment of your desires.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: Reflect upon your present blessings of which every man has many - not on your past misfortunes, of which all men have some.
h:
“Reflect upon your present blessings of which every man has many - not on your past misfortunes, of which all men have some.” —
Charles Dickens

q: She who loves roses must be patient and not cry out when she is pierced by thorns.
h:
“She who loves roses must be patient and not cry out when she is pierced by thorns.” —
Kenji Miyazawa

q: The farther backward you can look, the farther forward you are likely to see.
h:
“The farther backward you can look, the farther forward you are likely to see.” —
Winston Churchill

q: Write to help yourself, publish to help others.
h:
“Write to help yourself, publish to help others.” —
Jack Butcher

q: Dreams provide nourishment for the soul, just as a meal does for the body.
h:
“Dreams provide nourishment for the soul, just as a meal does for the body.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: A Hero is an ordinary individual who finds the strength to persevere and endure in spite of overwhelming obstacles.
h:
“A Hero is an ordinary individual who finds the strength to persevere and endure in spite of overwhelming obstacles.” —
Christopher Reeve

q: There exists only the present instant; a Now which always and without end is itself new.
h:
“There exists only the present instant; a Now which always and without end is itself new.” —
Meister Eckhart

q: I have lost friends, some by death...others by sheer inability to cross the street.
h:
“I have lost friends, some by death...others by sheer inability to cross the street.” —
Virginia Woolf

q: Our stories may be singular, but our destination is shared.
h:
“Our stories may be singular, but our destination is shared.” —
Barack Obama

q: It does not matter how slowly you go so long as you do not stop.
h:
“It does not matter how slowly you go so long as you do not stop.” —
Confucius

q: Once a decision was made, I didn't worry about it afterward.
h:
“Once a decision was made, I didn't worry about it afterward.” —
Harry S. Truman

q: It all depends on what you choose to believe.
h:
“It all depends on what you choose to believe.” —
Spencer Johnson

q: Normality is a paved road: It's comfortable to walk, but no flowers grow on it.
h:
“Normality is a paved road: It's comfortable to walk, but no flowers grow on it.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: You can avoid reality, but you cannot avoid the consequences of avoiding reality.
h:
“You can avoid reality, but you cannot avoid the consequences of avoiding reality.” —
Ayn Rand

q: Listen to the secret sound, the real sound, which is inside you.
h:
“Listen to the secret sound, the real sound, which is inside you.” —
Kabir

q: The biggest mistake we could ever make in our lives is to think we work for anybody but ourselves.
h:
“The biggest mistake we could ever make in our lives is to think we work for anybody but ourselves.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Be polite to all, but intimate with few.
h:
“Be polite to all, but intimate with few.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: A man has to learn that he cannot command things but that he can command himself; that he cannot coerce the wills of others but that he can mold and master his own will.
h:
“A man has to learn that he cannot command things but that he can command himself; that he cannot coerce the wills of others but that he can mold and master his own will.” —
James Allen

q: We can choose to look at whatever we want.  We can look at what's wrong in our life or we can look at what's right.
h:
“We can choose to look at whatever we want. We can look at what's wrong in our life or we can look at what's right.” —
Sonia Ricotti

q: Be brave to stand for what you believe in even if you stand alone.
h:
“Be brave to stand for what you believe in even if you stand alone.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: The universe doesn't allow perfection.
h:
“The universe doesn't allow perfection.” —
Stephen Hawking

q: You are the average of the five people you spend most time with.
h:
“You are the average of the five people you spend most time with.” —
Jim Rohn

q: One of the first signs of the beginning of understanding is the wish to die.
h:
“One of the first signs of the beginning of understanding is the wish to die. ” —
Franz Kafka

q: Confidence comes from crossing thresholds.
h:
“Confidence comes from crossing thresholds.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: To be fully alive is to feel that everything is possible.
h:
“To be fully alive is to feel that everything is possible.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: Your heart is the size of an ocean. Go find yourself in its hidden depths.
h:
“Your heart is the size of an ocean. Go find yourself in its hidden depths.” —
Rumi

q: People who have goals succeed because they know where they're going. It's that simple.
h:
“People who have goals succeed because they know where they're going. It's that simple.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: Speak when you are angry - and you'll make the best speech you'll ever regret.
h:
“Speak when you are angry - and you'll make the best speech you'll ever regret.” —
Laurence J. Peter

q: It is not uncommon for people to spend their whole life waiting to start living.
h:
“It is not uncommon for people to spend their whole life waiting to start living.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: He who knows how to wait need make no concessions.
h:
“He who knows how to wait need make no concessions.” —
Sigmund Freud

q: The most difficult times for many of us are the ones we give ourselves.
h:
“The most difficult times for many of us are the ones we give ourselves.” —
Pema Chodron

q: Don't worry about being successful, but work toward being significant and the success will naturally follow.
h:
“Don't worry about being successful, but work toward being significant and the success will naturally follow.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: Whenever people agree with me I always feel I must be wrong.
h:
“Whenever people agree with me I always feel I must be wrong.” —
Oscar Wilde

q: You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose.
h:
“You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose.” —
Dr. Seuss

q: A mountain never yields to the wind no matter how strong it is.
h:
“A mountain never yields to the wind no matter how strong it is.” —
Zen Proverb

q: Happiness is an effect of doing what you love, not an end goal to be achieved.
h:
“Happiness is an effect of doing what you love, not an end goal to be achieved.” —
Celestine Chua

q: You can put lipstick on a pig. It's still a pig.
h:
“You can put lipstick on a pig. It's still a pig.” —
Barack Obama

q: The person who cannot control his words shows that he cannot control himself.
h:
“The person who cannot control his words shows that he cannot control himself.” —
Robert Greene

q: The secret of getting started is breaking your complex, overwhelming tasks into small manageable tasks, and then starting on the first one.
h:
“The secret of getting started is breaking your complex, overwhelming tasks into small manageable tasks, and then starting on the first one.” —
Mark Twain

q: Excellence is not an exception, it is a prevailing attitude.
h:
“Excellence is not an exception, it is a prevailing attitude.” —
Colin Powell

q: For things to change, you have to change.
h:
“For things to change, you have to change.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Curiosity is the most powerful thing you own.
h:
“Curiosity is the most powerful thing you own.” —
James Cameron

q: No one has ever become poor by giving.
h:
“No one has ever become poor by giving.” —
Anne Frank

q: You came empty handed, and you will leave empty handed.
h:
“You came empty handed, and you will leave empty handed.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: When you know what you want, and want it bad enough, you will find a way to get it.
h:
“When you know what you want, and want it bad enough, you will find a way to get it.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Be Brave and Take Risks: You need to have faith in yourself. Be brave and take risks. You don't have to have it all figured out to move forward.
h:
“Be Brave and Take Risks: You need to have faith in yourself. Be brave and take risks. You don't have to have it all figured out to move forward.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: All I can do is be me, whoever that is.
h:
“All I can do is be me, whoever that is.” —
Bob Dylan

q: If you could kick the person in the pants responsible for most of your trouble, you wouldn't sit for a month.
h:
“If you could kick the person in the pants responsible for most of your trouble, you wouldn't sit for a month.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: Your first and foremost job as a leader is to take charge of your own energy and then help to orchestrate the energy of those around you.
h:
“Your first and foremost job as a leader is to take charge of your own energy and then help to orchestrate the energy of those around you.” —
Peter Drucker

q: You're on earth. There's no cure for that.
h:
“You're on earth. There's no cure for that.” —
Samuel Beckett

q: The eye with which I see God is the same eye with which God sees me.
h:
“The eye with which I see God is the same eye with which God sees me.” —
Meister Eckhart

q: A memory is a beautiful thing, it's almost a desire that you miss.
h:
“A memory is a beautiful thing, it's almost a desire that you miss.” —
Gustave Flaubert

q: Remain calm. Be kind.
h:
“Remain calm. Be kind.” —
Colin Powell

q: Creative endeavors are by their nature uncertain.
h:
“Creative endeavors are by their nature uncertain.” —
Robert Greene

q: We can have more than we've got because we can become more than we are.
h:
“We can have more than we've got because we can become more than we are.” —
Jim Rohn

q: The only way it gets better for you is when you get better. Better is not something you wish, it's something you become.
h:
“The only way it gets better for you is when you get better. Better is not something you wish, it's something you become.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Success is about creating value.
h:
“Success is about creating value.” —
Candice Carpenter

q: Saying nothing sometimes says the most.
h:
“Saying nothing sometimes says the most.” —
Emily Dickinson

q: Listen to what you know instead of what you fear.
h:
“Listen to what you know instead of what you fear.” —
Richard Bach

q: When you dance, your purpose is not to get to a certain place on the floor. It's to enjoy each step along the way.
h:
“When you dance, your purpose is not to get to a certain place on the floor. It's to enjoy each step along the way. ” —
Wayne Dyer

q: Many have died; you also will die. The drum of death is being beaten. The world has fallen in love with a dream. Only sayings of the wise will remain.
h:
“Many have died; you also will die. The drum of death is being beaten. The world has fallen in love with a dream. Only sayings of the wise will remain.” —
Kabir

q: Knowing is not enough, we must apply. Willing is not enough, we must do.
h:
“Knowing is not enough, we must apply. Willing is not enough, we must do.” —
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

q: If you can handle rejection, you'll learn to get everything you want.
h:
“If you can handle rejection, you'll learn to get everything you want.” —
Tony Robbins

q: The only person you should try to be better than is the person you were yesterday.
h:
“The only person you should try to be better than is the person you were yesterday.” —
Brian Tracy

q: If I can pay the bills, I'm happy.
h:
“If I can pay the bills, I'm happy.” —
Morgan Wootten

q: The whole world is a series of miracles, but we're so used to them we call them ordinary things.
h:
“The whole world is a series of miracles, but we're so used to them we call them ordinary things.” —
Hans Christian Andersen

q: To know even one life has breathed easier because you have lived. This is to have succeeded.
h:
“To know even one life has breathed easier because you have lived. This is to have succeeded.” —
Ralph Waldo Emerson

q: Be - don't try to become
h:
“Be - don't try to become ” —
Osho

q: If I love myself I love you. If I love you I love myself.
h:
“If I love myself I love you. If I love you I love myself.” —
Rumi

q: It is hard to fail, but it is worse never to have tried to succeed.
h:
“It is hard to fail, but it is worse never to have tried to succeed.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: Only to the extent that we expose ourselves over and over to annihilation can that which is indestructible in us be found.
h:
“Only to the extent that we expose ourselves over and over to annihilation can that which is indestructible in us be found.” —
Pema Chodron

q: The successful warrior is the average man, with laser-like focus.
h:
“The successful warrior is the average man, with laser-like focus.” —
Bruce Lee

q: At the center of your being you have the answer; you know who you are and you know what you want.
h:
“At the center of your being you have the answer; you know who you are and you know what you want.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Empty your mind, be formless, shapeless, like water.
h:
“Empty your mind, be formless, shapeless, like water.” —
Bruce Lee

q: You know you are on the road to success if you would do your job and not be paid for it.
h:
“You know you are on the road to success if you would do your job and not be paid for it.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched - they must be felt with the heart.
h:
“The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched - they must be felt with the heart.” —
Helen Keller

q: Courage is the willingness to engage in a risk-taking behavior regardless of whether the consequences are unknown or possibly adverse.
h:
“Courage is the willingness to engage in a risk-taking behavior regardless of whether the consequences are unknown or possibly adverse.” —
Alfred Adler

q: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
h:
“Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.” —
Winston Churchill

q: The more we have the less we own.
h:
“The more we have the less we own.” —
Meister Eckhart

q: The most virtuous are those who content themselves with being virtuous without seeking to appear so.
h:
“The most virtuous are those who content themselves with being virtuous without seeking to appear so.” —
Plato

q: Quiet people have the loudest minds.
h:
“Quiet people have the loudest minds.” —
Stephen King

q: Wit is educated insolence.
h:
“Wit is educated insolence.” —
Aristotle

q: There are only encounters in history. There are no accidents.
h:
“There are only encounters in history. There are no accidents.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: Time flies whether you are having fun or not.
h:
“Time flies whether you are having fun or not.” —
Mary Engelbreit

q: Life is a balance of holding on and letting go.
h:
“Life is a balance of holding on and letting go.” —
Rumi

q: No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another.
h:
“No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Do your duty and a little more and the future will take care of itself.
h:
“Do your duty and a little more and the future will take care of itself.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: Your vision will become clear only when you can look into your own heart.
h:
“Your vision will become clear only when you can look into your own heart.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: A comfort zone is a beautiful place, but nothing ever grows there.
h:
“A comfort zone is a beautiful place, but nothing ever grows there.” —
Unknown

q: You can discover what your enemy fears most by observing the means he uses to frighten you.
h:
“You can discover what your enemy fears most by observing the means he uses to frighten you.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: Success comes to those who become success conscious.
h:
“Success comes to those who become success conscious.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: We are all different. Don't judge, understand instead.
h:
“We are all different. Don't judge, understand instead.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: To accomplish big things, I am convinced you must first dream big dreams.
h:
“To accomplish big things, I am convinced you must first dream big dreams.” —
Conrad Hilton

q: Whatever satisfies the soul is truth.
h:
“Whatever satisfies the soul is truth.” —
Walt Whitman

q: Truth will always be truth, regardless of lack of understanding, disbelief or ignorance.
h:
“Truth will always be truth, regardless of lack of understanding, disbelief or ignorance. ” —
W. Clement Stone

q: Life is about choice. You can choose to be a victim or anything else you like to be.
h:
“Life is about choice. You can choose to be a victim or anything else you like to be.” —
Celestine Chua
